newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigerian oil shares gain in moderate trade.
newsitem.headline: Nigerian oil shares gain in moderate trade.

text.p: Petroleum marketing company shares made a strong showing in moderate Wednesday trading on the Nigerian stock exchange.
The all-share index closed at 6,158.09 from 6,146.99 on Tuesday.
Mobil and African Petroleum gained 15 kobo each to close 35.30 naira and 28.00 naira respectively. National Oil rose 12 kobo to 27.02 naira.
Bank shares were active, with Union Bank closing 10 kobo higher at 6.80 naira while UBA closed at 5.42 naira, up two kobo.
In the construction sector G. Cappa gained six kobo to 4.52 naira while Impresit Bakolori finished two kobo higher at 1.60 naira.
West African Portland Cement, Ashaka Cement and Benue Cement were all five kobo higher at 27.85 naira, 14.90 naira and 3.78 naira respectively.
Industrial Gases finished 10 kobo up at 11.10 naira, Cadbury rose by eight to 23.28 naira while Flour Mills of Nigeria advanced by five kobo to 8.50 naira.

Northern Nigerian Flour Mills announced a decline in full year profit to end-March 1996 but proposed the same 50 kobo dividend as last year. The shares went ex-dividend immediately, closing at 9.11 naira.
Conglomerate CFAO dropped five kobo to 5.80 naira. Nigerian Breweries fell two kobo to 13.73 naira.
